regions.Function: First processing stage of the state space ($S_t$). Extracts low-level features (oriented edges, spatial frequencies, local contrast) from the raw pixel environment. Acts as the initial convolutional layer in the vision encoder.
Refines V1 features, processing texture and complex contours. It acts as a router, splitting data into the dorsal (spatial/motion) and ventral (identity/form) streams.
Processes motion and spatial location. It feeds into the parietal cortex to help the agent determine 'where' potential targets are located, regardless of their identity.
Processes intermediate form and color. It filters the visual field for features that match the target's physical appearance (e.g., 'red', 'round').
The final stage of the 'What' pathway. It performs object classification, calculating a similarity score between the attended object and the target object in memory.
Integrates bottom-up saliency (from VACD/VACV) and top-down relevance (from PFCDL) into a scalar 'priority map'. This map represents the value $V(s)$ of attending to specific coordinates.
Holds the 'search template' (the target embedding) and the current policy $\pi$. It provides the top-down bias signal to PCIP to upweight target-relevant locations.
The actor head. It applies a winner-take-all (ArgMax or Softmax) operation on the PCIP priority map to select the discrete coordinate $(x, y)$ for the next saccade.
